glossary.definition: An instance of a survey distributed to participants for completion
An employee or person who is invited to complete a survey
The collected responses and calculated scores from completed surveys
The process of combining individual responses into summary statistics and insights

business_rules: Survey evaluations must be associated with valid survey template
Participants must be enrolled before receiving survey invitation
Survey completion requires all mandatory questions to be answered
Results are collected and stored upon survey submission
Participant anonymity must be maintained for anonymous surveys
Result aggregation requires minimum response threshold for validity
Survey evaluations can be scheduled for future distribution
Completion reminders are sent based on configuration
Results are calculated automatically or manually based on survey type
Survey history is maintained for each participant
calculations_or_formulas: Average score = sum of all participant scores / number of participants
invariants: Survey evaluation must be associated with valid survey
Participant must be valid and enrolled
Survey completion requires all mandatory questions answered
Result data must be valid and complete
Participant anonymity must be preserved for anonymous surveys
edge_cases: Participant doesn't complete survey - system sends reminders, tracks completion status, may close after deadline
Survey results are incomplete - system flags incomplete data, may require completion or exclude from aggregation
Participant submits survey multiple times - system handles based on policy (first? last? average?)
Result aggregation fails - system logs error, uses fallback calculation or manual processing
Survey anonymity is compromised - system detects violation, prevents access, logs security incident
Minimum response threshold is not met - system flags insufficient data, may require additional participants
Survey evaluation is cancelled - system handles enrolled participants, maintains history, may reschedule
Result interpretation requires manual review - system flags for review, assigns to reviewer, tracks review status
compliance_requirements: Survey results must be protected and access-controlled
Participant anonymity must be maintained for anonymous surveys
Result data must be retained for compliance and audit purposes
NOM-035 survey results must be reported to regulatory authorities
Survey data must comply with privacy regulations (GDPR, etc.)
user_journeys: HR creates survey evaluation - selects survey template and participants, evaluation is scheduled
System distributes survey - sends invitations to participants, tracks distribution status
Participant receives survey invitation - opens survey, answers questions, submits responses
System collects results - stores responses, calculates scores, aggregates data
HR views survey results - sees aggregated data, individual responses (if not anonymous), generates reports
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given survey evaluation creation, when template and participants are selected, then evaluation is created and scheduled
Given survey distribution, when participants are enrolled, then invitations are sent and distribution is tracked
Given survey completion, when participant submits responses, then completion is recorded and results are calculated
Given result aggregation, when minimum threshold is met, then results are aggregated and reports are generated
Given anonymous survey, when participant completes, then anonymity is maintained and results are aggregated without identification
open_questions: What is the minimum response threshold for result validity?
How are incomplete surveys handled? (excluded? included with missing data?)
What is the survey completion deadline? (fixed? flexible? reminders?)
How are survey results interpreted? (automatic? manual? hybrid?)
What is the process for NOM-035 result reporting? (frequency? format? authority?)
How are survey reminders configured? (frequency? method? escalation?)
assumptions: Survey evaluations are distributed to enrolled participants
Results are collected upon survey submission
Participant anonymity is maintained for anonymous surveys
Result aggregation requires minimum response threshold
Survey history is maintained for each participant
